definition: To move quietly and stealthily, often with the intention of not being noticed or heard. It is commonly used to describe the action of moving in a slow, sneaky, or surreptitious manner, typically associated with a cautious or secretive behavior.

examples.german: Er schleicht sich leise aus dem Raum.
examples.english: He sneaks quietly out of the room.

examples.german: Die Katze schleicht sich an ihre Beute heran.
examples.english: The cat creeps up on its prey.

examples.german: Sie schleicht sich heimlich aus dem Haus.
examples.english: She sneaks out of the house secretly.

examples.german: Der Dieb schleicht sich in das Gebäude.
examples.english: The thief sneaks into the building.

examples.german: Die Spinne schleicht sich langsam über die Wand.
examples.english: The spider crawls slowly across the wall.
